thread.section_title: Antonio Valencia could be Manchester United’s player of the season ahead of Zlatan Ibrahimovic, says Garth Crooks – Metro
thread.title: Antonio Valencia could be Manchester United’s player of the season ahead of Zlatan Ibrahimovic, says Garth Crooks
thread.title_full: Antonio Valencia could be Manchester United’s player of the season ahead of Zlatan Ibrahimovic, says Garth Crooks

author: George Bellshaw
title: Antonio Valencia could be Manchester United’s player of the season ahead of Zlatan Ibrahimovic, says Garth Crooks
text:
Valencia has enjoyed an excellent season (Picture: AMA/Getty) Garth Crooks believes Antonio Valencia deserves to be Manchester United ’s player of the season ahead of Zlatan Ibrahimovic.
CONFIRMED: Man City v Man Utd rearranged for a Thursday The former Tottenham Hotspur ace, who spent a season with the Red Devils, has been seriously impressed with the Ecuador international and included him in his team of the week.
Valencia scored his first goal of the 2016/17 campaign against Middlesbrough, capitalising on a Victor Valdes mistake to secure all three points in a 3-1 win.
The 31-year-old has started in 24 of United’s 27 matches in the Premier League, providing three assists for his team-mates, and has been a firm favourite under Jose Mourinho.
While Ibrahimovic has banged in 26 goals in all competitions this season and is the favourite to be named as their player of the year, Crooks believes Valencia should be in with a shout.
He told the BBC: ‘What a way to score your first goal of the season.
Ibrahimovic is expected to be named as their player of the year (Picture: AFP/Getty) ‘I was never one for chasing lost causes because logic seemed to suggest the cause was lost.
‘However, Antonio Valencia chased a ball that looked utterly futile to everyone except Valencia. It seemed the threat of Valencia’s speedy approach served to hurry Victor Valdes and in so doing caused the Boro goalkeeper to slip and offer the United player an empty net.
More: Football David Luiz provides major update on three-month knee injury 
Summer move? Barcelona chief speaks out on interest in Arsenal star 
Middlesbrough boss Steve Agnew lays blame on Man Utd players for tunnel bust-up 
‘At that point there must have been thousands of coaches justifying themselves to youngsters all over the country on why chasing lost causes has always been worthwhile.
‘As for Valencia, there can only be Zlatan Ibrahimovic stopping him from becoming United’s fans’ player of the season. I know who I would pick.’
MORE: Crooks slams ‘utterly shameful’ Jose Mourinho
